intro: Hieracium macilentum subsp. laricicola, commonly known as the alderleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and along stream banks. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems bear yellow composite flowers, which are arranged in a single terminal head. It is characterized by its association with alder trees, which contribute to its specific habitat requirements.
